ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.controllers

Class ChapterController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.controllers.ChapterController

  • public class ChapterController
extends java.lang.Object
    Role: Responsible for manipulating the current chapter model. It keeps a reference to the current chapter model as a field and updates that whenever the user makes changes. Every time the user creates a new chapter or updates a chapter, the changes (including any changes to its media or choices) will be saved to the database using the pushChangesToDb() method.

    Design Pattern: This class is a singleton, so only one instance of it will ever exist. use getInstance() to retrieve that instance, not the constructor.
    Author:
    Stephanie Gil

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ChapterController getInstance(Context context)
        Returns an instance of a ChapterController. The same instance is always returned since it is a singleton. This is the method every other class should be using to access the ChapterController. Note that this method must be called statically.

        Example call:
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        Parameters:
        context - Could be an activity or application context.

      • setCurrChapterIncomplete

        public void setCurrChapterIncomplete(java.util.UUID id)
        Sets its chapter to whatever chapter in the database matches the id passed in. Evidently, you only have the id of the chapter you want, not the chapter itself, so it is "incomplete".Therefore, this method will retrieve the chapter whose id matches the id you passed in, as well as all the choices and media belonging to that chapter and will set the corresponding fields in the chapter to them. Then you will have a "complete" chapter.

        Example call:
        UUID chapId = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7");
        Assume that there is a chapter in the database with the same id as chapId, and that it also has media and choices belonging to it in stored in the database.

        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterIncomplete(chapId);

        Parameters:
        id - Id of the chapter you want to retrieve. Must be a UUID.

      • setCurrChapterComplete

        public void setCurrChapterComplete(Chapter aChapter)
        Using this method means that you first have a "complete" chapter object, including all its media and choices. This method will set the chapter field of the ChapterController to be the chapter you are passing in so that it can be edited via methods defined in here. Example call:
        Chapter chap = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(chap);

        Parameters:
        aChapter -

      • getCurrChapter

        public Chapter getCurrChapter()
        Returns a reference to the current story model.

        Example Call:
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        Chapter mChap = control.getCurrChapter();

      • editText

        public void editText(java.lang.String text)
        Edits the chapter model's text. No view is allowed to do this directly, so they use this method.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        String text = "new text";
        control.editText(text);
        Parameters:
        text - String that you would like to set as the chapter's text.

      • editRandomChoice

        public void editRandomChoice(java.lang.Boolean bool)
        Edits the chapter model's random choice boolean (determines whether or not that chapter contains should contain a random choice). No view is allowed to do this directly, so they use this method.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.editRandomChoice(true);
        Parameters:
        bool -

      • removeIllustration

        public void removeIllustration(Media ill)
        Takes a media belonging to the chapter that you would like to remove and removes it.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        Media media = new Media(myChapter.getId(), null, "photo", "my comment");
        control.addPhoto(media);
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.removeIllustration(media);
        Parameters:
        ill - Illustration (type media) to be removed.

      • addChoice

        public void addChoice(Choice choice)
        Adds a choice to the chapter.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        Choice choice = new Choice(myChapter.getId(), "choice text");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.addChoice(choice);
        Parameters:
        choice - Choice object to be added.

      • addRandomChoice

        public void addRandomChoice()
        Adds an actual random choice object (which is just one of the chapter's current choices but with the text "I'm feeling lucky") to the chapter's choice array list.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.addRandomChoice();

      • updateChoice

        public void updateChoice(Choice newChoice)
        Updates a choice of the chapter. Does so by finding the choice in the chapter's choices array list, deleting it, and inserting the new version of it.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        Choice choice = new Choice(myChapter.getId(), "choice text"); ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.addChoice(choice);
        choice.setText("nennwweww");
        control.updateChoice(choice);
        Parameters:
        newChoice - Choice containing the new data you want to replace the old choice with.

      • addMedia

        public void addMedia(Media photo)
        Adds a media to the chapter. Can be a photo or an illustration, the method will decide for itself and add it to the correct array list.

        Example Call:
        Chapter myChapter = new Chapter(UUID.randomUUID(), "chap text");
        Media media = new Media(myChapter.getId(), null, "photo", "my comment");
        ChapterController control = ChapterController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrChapterComplete(myChapter);

        control.addMedia(media);
        Parameters:
        photo - Media object (photo) to be added.

      • pushChangesToDb

        public void pushChangesToDb()
        Any changes to the story model will now be pushed to the database so the database information is consistent.

        Example Call:
        Story myStory = new Story("Title", "author", "desc", "123bfdg6");
        StoryController control = StoryController.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        control.setCurrStoryComplete(myStory);

        control.editTitle("new title");
        control.pushChangesToServer();
